intro: Phellandrium conioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a glandular surface, contributing to its distinctive scent. Phellandrium conioides is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
